Generation V.Black: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
Generation V.White: The solar energy absorbed by its body's orange crystals is magnified internally and fired from its mouth.
Generation V.Black 2: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
Generation V.White 2: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.

Generation VI.X: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
Generation VI.Y: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

Generation VII.Sun: The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams have terrifying power. However, it's not able to fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.
Generation VII.Moon: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon is a popular partner for construction workers.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: When it fires off energy with all its might, the power creates countless fissures on its body.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out energy. It's usually lurking deep beneath the surface.

Generation VIII.Sword: This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah .
Generation VIII.Shield: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation—they can only be fired when the sun is out.

Generation VIII.Shield: Dusty Bowl ( Wanderer ) Rolling Fields , Giant's Seat , Stony Wilderness , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
